item.title: Prelim: Stochastic dominance
item.description: Stochastic dominance is a partial order on random variables. Let \(\ALPHABET S\) be a totally ordered finite set, say \(\{1, \dots, n\}\) and let \(\Delta(\ALPHABET S)\) denote the state of pmfs on \(\ALPHABET S\). Definition Suppose \(S^1\) and \(S^2\) are \(\ALPHABET S\) valued random variables where \(S^1 \sim \mu^1\) and \(S^2 \sim \mu^2\). We say \(S^1\) stochastically dominates \(S^2\) if for any \(s \in \ALPHABET S\), \[\begin{equation}\label{eq:inc-prob} \PR(S^1 \ge s) \ge \PR(S^2 \ge s).
